thread.title: Calgary Flames look for super effort to help stop skid
thread.title_full: Calgary Flames look for super effort to help stop skid

title: Calgary Flames look for super effort to help stop skid
text:
Report an error 
A crew of Calgary Flames -- Sam Bennett, Micheal Ferland, Dougie Hamilton and Josh Jooris -- dressed up as The Avengers for Thursday's visit to the Alberta Children's Hospital. 
As the Flames shoot for their first home-ice victory of the season, they could use a superhero-type performance from somebody in Friday's meeting with the Detroit Red Wings (Sportsnet One/Sportsnet 960 The Fan). 
"Everybody just has to worry about their part of the ice, their job," cautioned Flames captain Mark Giordano. "A lot of us, we're trying to overcompensate and do too much and that's when we're getting really in big trouble." 
The Flames (1-5-0) have dropped four straight. 
The Red Wings (3-3-0), meanwhile, arrived in Calgary on a three-game losing skid. 
Something has gotta give Friday. 
"I think the key now is that we really have to look at it one period at a time," Giordano said. "If we look big picture and we're thinking we need to win a bunch in a row, we're going to get into trouble. We have to focus on Detroit. They are a great team, a skilled team. We have to grind one out."
